alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 10:21AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall over the past few days. * WHERE...Escatawpa River and Earlville in northwest Mobile County. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1014 AM CDT, Mason Ferry Road north of Earlville Road at the Escatawpa River bridge remains closed due to the Escatawpa River`s water level. - Earlville Road between Mason Ferry Road and Scruggs Road has been reopened as waters have receded. However, residents are urged to use caution on the roadways as this week`s significant rainfall has affected various local watersheds. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Earlville. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
